title: More efficient logic needed for disk sorting with border row value
OB: When sorting data on disk, if the program is set to process less than 40000 rows, the following operations are performed:
EB: When sorting data on disk with a border row value, a more efficient logic is needed. Instead of directly sorting the data on disk, the data should be sorted directly in memory and then written to the file.
SR: 1. Set the program to process less than 40000 rows data. 2. Sort the data directly in memory. 3. Write the sorted data to the file on disk.
